Welcome to TRXO

Please complete the form below to access the documentation.

Your form could not be saved. Please try again. Your form has been submitted

Please enter your Details.

Enter your First Name Please add your First name Enter your Last Name Please add your Last name Enter your EMAIL Please use your business email address. Gmail, Yahoo and Hotmail are not allowed. Use your work/business email address (personal email domains are blocked) SUBMIT

docs.title: Advanced Features
docs.text: TRXO includes powerful safeguards and control mechanisms to ensure safe deployments.

docs.title: 🔍 Diff Preview (--diff)
docs.text:
"Know before you go." The diff feature compares the configuration in your source (File/Git) against the target environment before making any changes.

Usage: 

trxo import scripts --file alpha_scripts.json --diff

Comparing local script files with server configuration

Output: - Displays a summary of differences between server configuration and import file, including total items and counts of added, modified, and removed entries. - Presents a tabular view of detailed changes, listing each item’s ID, name, change type (Added / Modified / Removed), and a short summary. - Generates an HTML diff report with side-by-side, color-coded comparisons, highlighting exact field-level changes for each script or JSON configuration.

docs.title: 🍒 Cherry-Pick (--cherry-pick)
docs.text:
"Deploy exactly what you need." Instead of overwriting everything, select specific items to import.

Usage: 

# Import a single item
trxo import journeys --file alpha_journeys.json --cherry-pick LoginTree

# Import multiple items (comma-separated)
trxo import scripts --file alpha_scripts.json --cherry-pick script-id-1,script-id-2

Selecting specific scripts for import using cherry-pick

docs.title: 🔄 Sync Mode (--sync)
docs.text:
"Mirror source to target." By default, TRXO updates existing items and adds new ones. Sync mode ensures the target matches the source exactly by deleting items in the target that are missing from the source.

Usage: 

trxo import services --file alpha_services.json --sync
Use with caution! This will delete configurations in the target environment.

docs.title: ⏪ Rollback (--rollback)
docs.text:
"Safety net for deployments." Available in Git Mode. If you enable this flag, TRXO tracks the changes it makes during an import. If any error occurs midway, it automatically reverts the successful changes to restore the environment to its initial state.

Usage: 

trxo import scripts --branch release --rollback

docs.title: 📦 Batch Operations
docs.text:
"Bulk migration." Perform export or import operations for multiple configuration types (Scripts, Journeys, Services, etc.) in a single command.

See Batch Operations Guide for details.

docs.title: Overview
docs.text: TRXO supports batch operations to export and import multiple configurations in a single command. This is essential for full environment migrations or backups.

docs.title: Basic Usage
docs.text:
# Export multiple configurations to a directory
trxo batch export realms services themes --dir batch_exports

# Export all available configurations
trxo batch export realms services themes scripts saml journeys oauth users agents authn email_templates endpoints policies managed mappings connectors

docs.title: Advanced Options
docs.text:
# Continue on errors (default)
trxo batch export realms services themes --continue-on-error

# Stop on first error (Critical constraints)
trxo batch export realms services themes --stop-on-error

docs.title: Batch Import
docs.text: Batch import works by defining a configuration plan (Manifest) to ensure dependencies and order are respected.

docs.title: Step 1: Generate Configuration Template
docs.text:
# Generate import config template
trxo batch generate-config --type import --output my_imports.json

docs.title: Step 2: Edit Configuration File
docs.text:
Edit my_imports.json to define what to import:

{
  "description": "Migration Plan",
  "imports": [
    {
      "command": "scripts",
      "file": "scripts_export.json"
    },
    {
      "command": "journeys",
      "file": "journeys_export.json"
    }
  ]
}

docs.title: Step 3: Run Batch Import
docs.text:
# Import using config file
trxo batch import my_imports.json

# Dry run (Preview)
trxo batch import my_imports.json --dry-run

docs.title: Best Practices
docs.text:
1. Use Configuration Files: For complex migrations, define your plan in a JSON file rather than long CLI arguments.
  2. Test with Dry Run: Always validate the plan before execution.
  3. Handle Errors: Use --stop-on-error for critical production deployments where partial success is not acceptable.

docs.title: TRXO
docs.text:
TRXO is a configuration management and deployment tool for Ping Identity platforms — PingOne, PingAM, and PingIDM.

Manage, compare, and deploy Ping configurations safely and consistently.

docs.title: Why TRXO?
docs.text:
• Reduce risk from manual console changes
  • Clear diffs & previews before import
  • Git-backed storage, audit trails, and rollback
  • Designed for CI/CD and enterprise workflows

docs.title: Key features
docs.text:
• Hybrid migration across Ping platforms
  • Intelligent diff preview for OAuth2 clients and managed objects
  • Git-backed storage & selective deployment
  • Dependency-aware exports and safe rollbacks

docs.title: Get started
docs.text:
Choose how you’d like to begin:

  • Installation Set up TRXO locally and install dependencies

  • Usage Learn core commands and common workflows

  • Setup & Authentication Configure Ping environments and service accounts

docs.title: TRXO Installation Guide
docs.text: This guide describes how to install the TRXO CLI tool.

docs.title: Prerequisites
docs.text:
• Python 3.10 or higher
  • pip (Python package installer)
  • Access to a PingOne Advanced Identity Cloud tenant or PingAM instance.

docs.title: Method 1: Install from Source (Recommended)
docs.text:
1. Clone the repository: 

    git clone https://github.com/Trevonix/trxo.git
cd trxo

  2. Install the package: 

    pip install -e .

docs.title: Method 2: Development Setup
docs.text:
For contributors:

  1. Clone and enter directory: 

    git clone https://github.com/Trevonix/trxo.git
cd trxo

  2. Create virtual environment: 

    python -m venv venv
source venv/bin/activate  # Windows: venv\Scripts\activate

  3. Install with dev dependencies: 

    pip install -e ".[dev]"

docs.title: Verify Installation
docs.text:
Check that the CLI is accessible:

trxo --help

docs.title: Service account tokens: scopes and effective lifetime
docs.text: Short guide applicable to all APIs in this project (ESV, OAuth clients, Journeys, SAML, etc.).

docs.title: Problem observed
docs.text:
• Token response shows expires_in ≈ 899s (~15 minutes)
  • Some API calls start failing with 401/expired token around ~3 minutes

docs.title: Why this happens
docs.text:
• The service account wasn’t granted (or the request didn’t include) the required API scopes.
  • Without the right scopes for the endpoints you call, tokens can behave as if they expire early even when expires_in is higher.

docs.title: Fix (applies globally)
docs.text:
• Include the exact scopes required by the APIs you are calling when requesting the token.
  • Ensure the service account is permitted to request those scopes.
  • Example: for ESV operations you typically need fr:idc:esv:* in the requested scopes.

Example (conceptual):

scope=fr:idc:esv:* <other-api-specific-scopes>

docs.title: Verify
docs.text:
1. Request a new token with the updated scopes
  2. Confirm the response expires_in (e.g., 899)
  3. Call your target APIs again after 3–5 minutes — they should still succeed up to the expected lifetime

docs.title: Best practices
docs.text:
• Request the minimal, correct scopes per API
  • If behavior seems off, double‑check: requested scopes, allowed scopes for the client, and correct token endpoint/tenant

docs.title: Minimal scopes
docs.text:
• ESV (Environment Secrets & Variables)
  • Read-only: fr:idc:esv:read
  • Create/Update/Delete: fr:idc:esv:update
  • Restart service to inject changes: fr:idc:esv:restart
  • All ESV operations: fr:idc:esv:*
  • AM APIs (/am/*): fr:am:*
  • IDM APIs (/openidm/*): fr:idm:*
  • Note: docs state tokens with fr:idm:* also have ESV access, but this is deprecated. Don’t rely on it going forward.

docs.title: Official docs
docs.text: • Service account scopes: https://docs.pingidentity.com/pingoneaic/latest/tenants/service-accounts.html#service-account-scopes

docs.title: Project Setup & Authentication
docs.text: This guide covers the initial configuration required to start using TRXO with your Ping Identity environments.

docs.title: 1. Project Initialization
docs.text:
TRXO uses "Projects" to organize configurations for different tenant migrations or environments.

# Create a new project workspace
trxo project create my-ping-migration

# Switch to the project
trxo project switch my-ping-migration

docs.title: 2. Configuration Setup
docs.text:
Once inside a project, run the setup wizard to configure your Storage Mode and Authentication.

trxo config setup
Follow the prompts to select: * Storage: Local Filesystem or Git Repository (See Storage Setup Guide). * Authentication: Service Account (Cloud) or On-Premise.

docs.title: 3. Authentication Methods
docs.text: TRXO supports secure authentication for both PingOne Advanced Identity Cloud and PingAM/PingIDM.

docs.title: PingOne Advanced Identity Cloud
docs.text:
Authenticates using a Service Account.

Setup in Config (Interactive): 

trxo config setup
# Default to 'service-account' mode
# Provide path to JWK file and Service Account ID

CLI Argument (CI/CD / One-off): 

trxo config setup --jwk-path /path/to/private.key \
  --client-id service-account-client-id \
  --sa-id service-account-uuid \
  --base-url https://<tenant>.forgeblocks.com

docs.title: PingAM / PingIDM (On-Premise)
docs.text:
Authenticates using Username/Password.

Setup in Config (Interactive): 

trxo config setup --auth-mode onprem
# Provide Base URL (e.g., https://am.example.com or https://am.example.com/am)
# Provide Username and Password

CLI Argument (CI/CD / One-off): 

trxo config setup --auth-mode onprem \
  --base-url https://am.example.com/am \
  --onprem-username amAdmin \
  --onprem-password SecurityPhrase1!

docs.title: Token Management
docs.text:
TRXO handles token lifecycle automatically. - Auto-Refresh: Tokens are refreshed if they expire during long operations. - Scopes: Ensure your Service Account has required scopes (e.g., fr:am:*, fr:idm:*,fr:idc:esv:*).

For more information on required scopes, see Service Account Token Lifetime and Scopes.

docs.title: Storage Modes: Local vs Git
docs.text: TRXO offers two storage modes to suit your workflow: Local Filesystem and Git Repository.

docs.title: 📂 Local Mode (Default)
docs.text:
Ideal for ad-hoc backups or quick transfers between environments.

How it works: - Exports are saved as JSON files in a local ./exports/ directory (or custom path). - Imports read directly from these JSON files.

Usage: 

# Export to local file
trxo export scripts

# Import from local file
trxo import scripts --file ./exports/scripts_timestamp.json

docs.title: 🐙 Git Mode
docs.text:
Ideal for team collaboration, version history, audit logs, and automated deployments.

How it works: - TRXO connects directly to a remote Git repository (GitHub, GitLab, etc.). - Exports create a commit on a specified branch. - Imports read configurations directly from the repository structure.

docs.title: Setup
docs.text:
1. Prepare a Repository: Create an empty repo (e.g., ping-configs) on your Git provider.
  2. Configure TRXO: 
    trxo config setup
# When prompted for storage, select 'git' (or configure git settings manually)
# Provide: Git Username, Personal Access Token (PAT), and Repository URL

docs.title: Usage
docs.text:
# Export to 'develop' branch
trxo export scripts --branch develop --message "Updated authentication scripts"

# Import from 'main' branch
trxo import scripts --branch main

docs.title: Benefits of Git Mode
docs.text:
• Rollback Support: Use --rollback to automatically revert changes if an import fails.
  • Audit Trail: Every change is a commit with a timestamp and author.
  • Structure: Configurations are organized by Realm and Component type automatically (e.g., alpha/scripts/my-script.json).

docs.title: TRXO Usage Guide
docs.text: This guide outlines the standard workflow for managing Ping Identity configurations.

docs.title: 1. Project Workflow
docs.text:
Start by creating a dedicated workspace for your specific migration or environment task.

Create a Project: 

trxo project create my-migration-project

List Projects: 

trxo projects

Switch Context: 

trxo project switch my-migration-project

docs.title: 2. Configuration
docs.text:
Initialize your project configuration for Authentication and Storage.

trxo config setup
* For detailed Authentication options, see Project Setup & Auth Guide. * For detailed Storage Mode setup (Local vs Git), see Storage Setup Guide.

View Current Configuration: 

trxo config show
# displays current configuration

docs.title: 3. Export Commands
docs.text: Export configurations from your source environment.

docs.title: Basic Export
docs.text:
# Export all scripts from the default realm (alpha)
trxo export scripts

Exporting AM scripts to local storage

docs.title: General Options
docs.text:
Specific Realm: Export from a non-default realm (e.g., 'bravo' or root). 

trxo export scripts --realm bravo

View Data (Dry Run): Preview data in the terminal without saving to file. 

trxo export realms --view

Previewing realm configuration in the terminal

View Specific Columns: Restrict the view output to specific fields (e.g., just IDs and Names). 

trxo export realms --view --view-columns _id,name

docs.title: Local Storage Options (Filesystem Only)
docs.text:
Custom Directory: Save export files to a specific directory. Creates the directory if it doesn't exist. 

trxo export journeys --dir journeys-export

Custom Filename: Save to a specific manual filename. 

trxo export journeys --file new-journeys

Specific Version: Tag the export file with a semantic version. 

trxo export journeys --version prod-ready

docs.title: Git Storage Options (Git Mode Only)
docs.text:
Branch: Export to a specific branch. If the branch exists, it adds/updates files; if not, it creates the branch. 

trxo export oauth --branch bravo-oauth2-clients

Commit Message: Provide a custom commit message describing the export. 

trxo export oauth --branch bravo-oauth2-clients --message "Exporting OAuth2 Clients from tenant"

docs.title: CI/CD & Automation
docs.text:
Run exports without interactive prompts or project setup by passing credentials directly.

PingOne Advanced Identity Cloud (Service Account): 

trxo export scripts \
  --jwk-path /path/to/private.key \
  --client-id service-account-client-id \
  --sa-id service-account-uuid \
  --base-url https://<tenant>.forgeblocks.com

PingAM (On-Premise): 

trxo export scripts \
  --auth-mode onprem \
  --base-url https://am.example.com/am \
  --onprem-username amAdmin \
  --onprem-password SecurityPhrase1!

docs.title: 4. Import Commands
docs.text:
Import configurations into your target environment. Options vary based on Local or Git storage mode.

View Available Commands: 

trxo import --help

docs.title: Local File System
docs.text:
Import configuration files from your local directory.

Standard Import: Imports from local file to default realm (alpha). 

trxo import authn --file <file-name>

Importing authentication configuration from a file

Specific Realm: Import file content to a specific target realm. 

trxo import authn --file <file-name> --realm <realm-name>

Cherry-Pick: Import only specific items (single ID or comma-separated list). 

trxo import scripts --file <file-name> --cherry-pick id1,id2

Diff Mode: Compare the import file against the target environment before applying changes. 

trxo import scripts --file <file-name> --diff

Sync Mode: Mirror the import data to the target (deletes extra items on server). 

trxo import scripts --file <file-name> --sync

Force Import: Skip hash integrity checks if file was manually modified. 

trxo import scripts --file <file-name> --force-import

docs.title: Git Mode
docs.text:
Import configurations directly from the linked Git repository.

Default Branch: Takes data from the currently checked-out branch. 

trxo import scripts

Specific Branch: Import data from a specific branch. 

trxo import scripts --branch <branch-name>

Rollback: Automatically restore previous state if import fails (Git mode only). 

trxo import scripts --rollback

docs.title: CI/CD & Automation
docs.text:
PingOne Advanced Identity Cloud: 

trxo import scripts --file <file-name> \
  --jwk-path /path/to/private.key \
  --client-id service-account-client-id \
  --sa-id service-account-uuid \
  --base-url https://<tenant>.forgeblocks.com

PingAM (On-Premise): 

trxo import scripts --file <file-name> \
  --auth-mode onprem \
  --base-url https://am.example.com/am \
  --onprem-username amAdmin \
  --onprem-password SecurityPhrase1!

For more detailed explanations, see Advanced Features Guide.

docs.title: 5. Batch Operations
docs.text:
Execute multiple configuration commands in a single operation.

View Available Commands: 

trxo batch --help

docs.title: Batch Export
docs.text:
Export All: Runs the export for all supported commands. 

trxo batch export --all

Selected Commands: Export specific configuration types in one shot. 

trxo batch export authn services

Executing multiple export commands in batch mode

Error Handling: Pause execution immediately if any command fails (default is continue-on-error). 

trxo batch export authn services managed --stop-on-error

docs.title: Batch Import
docs.text:
From Directory: Searches the directory for files matching the specified commands and imports them. 

trxo batch import --dir batch-export/ command1 command2

From Config File: Import using a JSON manifest file containing detailed paths and options. 

trxo batch import --config-file batch_config.json

For more details, see Batch Operations Guide.

docs.title: 6. Log Management
docs.text:
Manage and monitor TRXO application logs for troubleshooting and auditing.

View Recent Logs: Displays the last 20 lines of logs in the console. 

trxo logs show

Advanced Log View: Filter logs and follow live output. 

trxo logs show --lines 30 --follow --level INFO
* --lines: Specify the number of lines to display from the end. * --follow: Monitor logs live as they are written. * --level: Filter by log level (DEBUG, INFO, WARNING, ERROR).

View Log Configuration: Displays log file paths, current level, and retention settings. 

trxo logs info
